post_text:
The 2020 Census will impact the next generation! Data collected will inform funding for special ed, teacher training, youth programs and more. By filling out the census, we're using our power to give our kids a brighter future.

¡El Censo de 2020 afectará a la siguiente generación! Los datos recopilados determinarán los fondos para la educación especial, la capacitación de maestros, los programas juveniles y más. Al completar el censo, estamos utilizando nuestro poder para darles a nuestros hijos un futuro mejor.

Congratulations to Briscoe Elementary! Briscoe is the only school who placed in the top three of every tournament hosted this year, placing first in soccer, second in volleyball and third in basketball.

Congratulations to Briscoe Elementary’s i play! afterschool team who won the 2019-20 H-E-B Tournament of Champions President’s Cup. text:
Congratulations to Briscoe Elementary! Briscoe is the only school who placed in the top three of every tournament hosted this year, placing first in soccer, second in volleyball and third in basketball.

¡Felicidades a Briscoe Elementary! Briscoe es la única escuela que calificó en los primeros tres logares de cada torneo que se llevó a cabo este año. Obtuvo el primer lugar en fútbol, segundo en vólibol y tercero en baloncesto.

San Antonio Sports
April 14 at 8:17 PM ·

Congratulations to Briscoe Elementary’s i play! afterschool team who won the 2019-20 H-E-B Tournament of Champions President’s Cup. Briscoe (San Antonio ISD) won the cup based on i play! afterschool tournament success, tournament participation and attendance, and demonstrated sportsmanship. 🏆 #HEBTOC https://bit.ly/3a8lm6t

Fewer pickups, more meals! Curbside meals are now delivered to 29 campuses Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays - now with 2-3 suppers per week! Bus-stop deliveries remain 5x a week at 65 bus stops. https://www.saisd.net/page/article/227

Las entregas en las paradas de autobuses escolares permaneces 5 veces a la semana en 65 paradas de autobús. https://www.saisd.net/page/article/227

post_text:
Be counted! It’s never been easier to respond to the census questionnaire on your own, whether online, over the phone, or by email—all without having to meet a census taker. Go to www.2020Census.gov to complete the Census questionnaire online or call (844) 330-2020 to talk to a live Census employee who can help you fill out your questionnaire over the phone.

Nunca ha sido tan fácil responder al cuestionario del censo por su propia cuenta, ya sea en línea, por teléfono, o por correo electrónico—todo sin tener que reunirse con un trabajador del censo. Vaya a www.2020Census.gov para completar el cuestionario del Censo en línea o llame al (844) 330-2020 para hablar en vivo con un empleado del Censo que le pueda ayudar a completar su cuestionario por teléfono.

Beginning Monday, April 13, curbside meals move to 3-day distribution: Monday-Wednesday-Friday. Fewer pickups, more meals! Now with 2-3 suppers per week! Bus-stop deliveries remain 5x a week.

A partir del lunes, 13 de abril, las comidas para llevar en las escuelas se distribuirán tres días a la semana: lunes, miércoles y viernes. ¡Menos viajes, más comidas! ¡Ahora con dos o tres cenas por semana!

Details here / detalles aquí: https://www.saisd.net/page/article/227

post_text:
Meal Distribution Reminder: This is a 4-day week! On Thursday, families will receive one additional meal and snack for each child since there will be no meal pickup on Friday. This affects both curbside and bus-stop pickups.

Recordatorio de distribución de comidas: ¡esta es una semana de 4 días! El jueves las familias recibirán una comida y un refrigerio adicionales para cada niño debido a que no habrá comidas para llevar el viernes. Esto afecta tanto a las comidas para llevar en las escuelas como en las paradas de autobús.

Employees running our curbside meal locations were treated to Jason’s Deli in appreciation for all of their hard work and service to the children in our community. They need to eat too! Pictured are employees in the Lowell Middle School cafeteria.

Los empleados encargados de nuestros sitios de distribución de comidas escolares para llevar recibieron comida de Jason’s Deli a modo de aprecio por su ardua labor y el servicio a los niños de nuestra comunidad. ¡Ellos también tienen que comer! En la foto salen empleados en la cafetería de Lowell Middle School.

This is the first in a new video series for sharing information with families as our classrooms shift to a digital learning environment. A new video on a different topic will be added to the series weekly. This episode features Superintendent Pedro Martinez and Chief Academic Officer Patti Salzmann answering common questions we've been receiving regarding academics: https://youtu.be/QVsE-g28o50

Este es el primero en una nueva serie de videos para compartir información con las familias a medida que nuestros salones de clase cambian a un entorno de aprendizaje digital. Se agregará un nuevo video sobre un tema diferente a la serie cada semana. Este episodio cuenta con el Superintendente Pedro Martinez y la Directora Académica Ejecutiva Patti Salzmann que contestan preguntas comunes que hemos recibido en cuanto a los estudios académicos: https://youtu.be/QVsE-g28o50

post_text:
Practice Social Distancing
To avoid the spread of COVID-19 in our community, practice social distancing:
• Avoid going out in public
• When in public, keep six feet of distance between you and others
• Follow guidance provided by local and state officials.
Get more information at https://texas.gov/covid19
#covid19 #texasstrong #stayhome

Practica el distanciamiento social
Para prevenir la propagación de COVID-19 en nuestra comunidad, practique el distanciamiento social:
• Evite salir en público
• Cuando esté en público, mantenga una distancia de seis pies entre usted y los demás.
• Seguir las recomendaciones de los funcionarios locales y estatales.
Obtenga más información en https://texas.gov/covid19
# covid19 #texasfuerte #quedateencasa

post_text:
This morning, Rogers Middle School distributed 300 laptops to their students to ensure access to online learning. The school will continue to deploy devices to its families, and each SAISD campus is reaching out to its families to inform them of their individual campus distribution dates and times. These will vary by campus. Families can expect to hear from their schools over this week and next. Want to help? Learn more at https://www.saisdfoundation.com/donate/

Esta mañana, Rogers Middle School distribuyó 300 computadoras portátiles a sus estudiantes para asegurar el acceso al aprendizaje en línea. La escuela seguirá entregando los dispositivos a las familias, y cada plantel de SAISD se está comunicando con sus familias para informarles sobre las fechas y los horarios de distribución. La fecha y los horarios varían por plantel. Las familias pueden esperar que sus escuelas se comuniquen esta semana o la que entra.

post_text:
Exciting change for curbside meal pickup, beginning Tuesday, March 31:
For meal pickups at our 29 curbside locations, you may continue to bring your child OR if you wish to come without your child, please tape ONE of the following documents to your windshield:
- Official letter/email from school listing enrolled child
- Individual student report cards
- Attendance record from parent portal of school website
- Birth certificate for child
- Student ID card

Cambio emocionante para el programa de comidas escolares para llevar, a partir del 31 de marzo:
Para recoger comidas en nuestras 29 ubicaciones escolares, puede seguir trayendo a su hijo/a O si desea venir sin su hijo/a, por favor adjunte uno de los documentos a continuación en su parabrisas:
• Carta/correo electrónico oficial que mencione al estudiante matriculado
• Boletas de calificaciones de estudiantes individuales
• Registro de asistencia del portal para padres del sitio web escolar
• Certificado de nacimiento del niño/a
• Tarjeta de ID del estudiante

Truth Hurts: Online Learning At Ogden

Ogden Academy
March 27 at 7:20 PM ·

Online Learning starts Monday, March 30! We miss you and we are so excited to teach you!

SAISD serves more than 10,000 meals a day! Today our curbside delivery program rolled out a weekend snack and breakfast, which will begin accompanying Friday meals at our campus-based, curbside sites. We were on hand at J.T. Brackenridge Elementary School to see how it went!

¡SAISD sirve más de 10,000 comidas al día! Hoy, nuestro programa de comidas para llevar comenzó a ofrecer un refrigerio y un desayuno para el fin de semana, los cuales formarán parte de las comidas del viernes en nuestros sitios escolares. ¡Estuvimos en J.T. Brackenridge Elementary School para ver cómo les fue!

We accelerated a three-year plan to a three-week plan to provide 1:1 technology across our District, and we are rallying the community to support the hotspots needed for home internet access through the SAISD Foundation’s #ConnectCampaign. The first hotspots are arriving now. Learn more about the campaign here: https://www.saisdfoundation.com/

Aceleramos un plan de tres años a tres semanas a fin de proporcionar tecnología 1:1 a todo nuestro Distrito, y estamos movilizando a la comunidad para ayudar a adquirir los puntos de acceso wifi que se necesitan para el acceso a internet en casa por medio de la #ConnectCampaign de SAISD Foundation. Ya están llegando los primeros puntos de acceso wifi. Aprenda más sobre la campaña aquí: https://www.saisdfoundation.com/

post_text:
SAISD is excited to hear about the approved waiver allowing parents to pick up meals without students present, which may make this easier for families. Child Nutrition Programs are currently waiting on guidance around the implementation from the Texas Department of Agriculture – to include some sort of identification system to ensure that children are being served. Please note that until this is implemented, students will need to be present at the time of pick up. More information to come.

SAISD está entusiasmado por la exención aprobada que permite que los padres recojan comidas sin que los estudiantes estén presentes, lo cual podría facilitar esto para las familias. Los Programas de Nutrición Infantil actualmente están en espera de las directrices para la implementación por parte del Departamento de Agricultura de Texas, que incluirán algún tipo de sistema de identificación para asegurar que se está sirviendo a los niños. Por favor tenga en cuenta que hasta que esto se implemente, los estudiantes tendrán que estar presentes a la hora de recoger. Más información próximamente.

Ayer los miembros del personal de Twain Dual Language Academy comenzaron a distribuir los dispositivos a las familias que expresaron una necesidad de tecnología para acceder al aprendizaje a distancia. Se distribuyeron 60 dispositivos el lunes, y esa labor continúa esta semana. Este es solo un ejemplo de cómo estamos trabajando juntos. ¡Somos un SAISD unido!

Yesterday, staff members at Twain Dual Language Academy began distributing devices to families who expressed a need for technology in order to access remote learning. Sixty devices were distributed Monday, and that work continues throughout this week. Just another way we are pulling through this together. We are SAISD strong!

post_text:
The District launched "SAISD Eats" today, a collaboration between Child Nutrition Services and Transportation. School buses were mobilized to 27 bus stops, delivering more than 700 meals to students on the first day. This was in addition to the 27 campuses providing curbside pickups, which provides more than 5,000 meals a day. See locations and times for both programs here: https://www.saisd.net/upload/page/0023/docs/Meal%20sites%20and%20Transportation%20delivery%20sites_English.pdf

El Distrito lanzó "Comidas SAISD" el día de hoy, una colaboración entre los Servicios de Nutrición Infantil y de Transporte. Los autobuses escolares se enviaron a 27 paradas de autobús y entregaron más de 700 comidas a estudiantes el primer día. Esto fue además de las 27 escuelas que están ofreciendo comidas para llevar, lo cual proporciona más de 5,000 comidas diarias. Vea las ubicaciones y las horas para ambos programas aquí: https://www.saisd.net/upload/page/0023/docs/Meal%20sites%20and%20Transportation%20delivery%20sites_Spanish%20Review.pdf

post_text:
We love our families. Our District staff—including principals, teachers, family engagement specialists, counselors and social workers—are working hard to ensure we reach everyone in SAISD with information about our food service, online learning opportunities, technology plans and other supports. Know anyone who is not getting the information? PLEASE reach out to us at COVIDInfo@SAISD.net.

Queremos a nuestras familias. Nuestro personal del distrito —incluso directores, maestros, especialistas de participación familiar, consejeros y trabajadores sociales— están trabajando arduamente para asegurar que la información sobre nuestro servicio de comida, las oportunidades de aprendizaje en línea, los planes de tecnología y otro apoyo llegue a todos en SAISD. ¿Sabe de alguien que no está recibiendo la información? POR FAVOR comuníquese con nosotros en COVIDInfo@SAISD.net.

post_text:
Remote Learning Opportunities: We are working toward purchasing 30,000 electronic devices and additional hotspots for internet connectivity, with the goal of closing the digital divide for children in our community. This is an incredibly ambitious undertaking that we had planned to meet within three years. The time is now, though, and our goal is to close the gap in two weeks.

Oportunidades de aprendizaje a distancia: estamos trabajando para comprar 30,000 dispositivos electrónicos y puntos de acceso wifi para la conexión a internet con la meta de cerrar la brecha digital para los estudiantes en nuestra comunidad. Este es un emprendimiento muy complejo que teníamos planeado lograr dentro de tres años. Sin embargo, se ha llegado la hora y nuestra meta es cerrar la brecha en dos semanas.
text:
Remote Learning Opportunities: We are working toward purchasing 30,000 electronic devices and additional hotspots for internet connectivity, with the goal of closing the digital divide for children in our community. This is an incredibly ambitious undertaking that we had planned to meet within three years. The time is now, though, and our goal is to close the gap in two weeks.

Oportunidades de aprendizaje a distancia: estamos trabajando para comprar 30,000 dispositivos electrónicos y puntos de acceso wifi para la conexión a internet con la meta de cerrar la brecha digital para los estudiantes en nuestra comunidad. Este es un emprendimiento muy complejo que teníamos planeado lograr dentro de tres años. Sin embargo, se ha llegado la hora y nuestra meta es cerrar la brecha en dos semanas.

SAISD is expanding its school-closure meal sites to 27 campuses beginning tomorrow, Wednesday, March 18. Students do not need to be enrolled in SAISD to participate, but must be 18 years of age and younger. Children receiving meals must be present at the time of pick up.

Meals, which now include hot lunch entrée options, are available at the following sites: https://www.saisd.net/page/article/227

SAISD está ampliando las ubicaciones de comidas durante el cierre escolar a 27 planteles a partir de mañana, miércoles, 18 de marzo. Los estudiantes no tienen que estar inscritos en SAISD para participar, pero deben tener 18 años de edad o menos. Los niños que reciban comidas deben estar presentes a la hora de recoger.

Las comidas, que ahora incluyen opciones de platillo caliente, están disponibles en los sitios a continuación: https://www.saisd.net/page/article/227

post_text:
UPDATE: SAISD is aware that some local universities and colleges are suspending in-class instruction temporarily. At this time, we anticipate normal school operations on Monday, March 16. We will work with our early college high school students beginning next week to ensure they have devices to use from our schools to accommodate the change among higher education institutions.

We will continue to monitor the situation closely and will follow the guidance of local health authorities. We will continue to keep you updated here and on our website at https://www.saisd.net/page/article/213

Today was a hard hat, safety vest, and closed-toe shoes kind of day for Jefferson High School students as they participated in the citywide Job Shadow Day coordinated by San Antonio Works. The architecture students shadowed Pfluger Architects at one of their job sites.

More than 840 SAISD high school students participated in the event today, job shadowing more than 30 industry partners. Citywide, Job Shadow Day attracts almost 4,000 students and over 140 employer participants.

post_text: Congratulations to Highlands, Edison and Sam Houston girls basketball teams! All three schools are advancing to the second round of the state basketball playoffs. Brackenridge girls basketball also advanced earlier this week. In the bi-district games, Highlands overwhelmed Southwest Legacy 80-60, Edison beat Somerset 58-45 and Sam Houston knocked off Harlan 45-41. Highlands, 28-8, will now meet Kerrville Tivy, 20-4, Friday at 6 pm at the Paul Taylor Field House off Loop 410 and Culebra Rd. Edison, 25-7, will meet Veterans Memorial, 27-7, tonight at 7 pm at Jefferson HS gym. Sam Houston, 18-17, will meet Wagner, 19-8, Friday at 7:30 pm at Northside Sports Gym near Loop 1604 and Bandera Rd. Adrianna Wiatrek is the coach for Highlands, Angelita Johnson is the coach for Edison and Marchae Woods is the coach for Sam Houston. This is the second straight year that all four schools – Highlands, Edison, Sam Houston and Brackenridge – all won their respective bi-district state playoff games. Go SAISD!

post_text: Here’s a big shout out to the Brackenridge girls basketball team. The Lady Eagles overpowered Medina Valley 65-47 last night to win the Class 5A bi-district championship. This is the second straight year that the Lady Eagles have won the bi-district title. Brack, 19-15 overall, will now advance to the second round of the state playoffs and meet Boerne Champion, 26-9 overall, Thursday at 7 pm at Northside Gym near Loop 1604 and Bandera Rd. Tamiko Matthews, a graduate of Brack, is in her 7th year coaching the team. The squad is led by Skye Thomas and Lily Zamora, who both have scored more than 1,000 points in their 4 years playing varsity basketball. Genesis Teran is another star player for the team. Go Brack! Go SAISD!

post_text:
Three outstanding educators were honored last night at SAISD’s 2020 Distinguished Teachers of the Year ceremony. They are Christina Leal, special education teacher at Advanced Learning Academy (PK-3); Marie Marks, Spanish teacher at Young Women’s Leadership Academy; and Adriana Abundis, mathematics teacher at Lanier High School.

A total of 89 teachers and librarians across the District were celebrated as Teachers of the Year for their individual schools during the ceremony held at the Alamo Convocation Center.

Read more: https://www.saisd.net/page/article/206

post_text: Briscoe Elementary - and International Baccalaureate (IB) World School - held its annual IB exhibition last week. Students shared information on all the community research and projects they've been working on. What a great job these students are doing!
shared_text:
City of San Antonio Office of Historic Preservation
February 7 at 4:31 PM ·

We would like to congratulate Briscoe Elementary for putting together an amazing exhibition of student projects last night! The purpose of the event was to promote understanding and empower problem solving that can lead to action. Topics included homelessness, clean water, recycling, and climate change, among others. Also on display were student-led research projects on Briscoe’s fascinating history dating back to 1904 and the campus’ beautiful original building materials such as masonry. These historical research projects were part of an effort now underway to implement a cultural heritage curriculum at SAISD schools, per an agreement between the City of San Antonio and SAISD approved by City Council last year. Briscoe is one of three schools participating in a pilot program that will eventually pave the way for district-wide expansion of the cultural heritage curriculum. We appreciate all your hard work, Briscoe! Go Briscoe Bears! #livingheritagesa

post_text: Solar Mural Unveiling: J.T. Brackenridge Elementary School, in partnership with the Esperanza Peace and Justice Center, unveiled a clean-energy art installation on the campus today. The project was created with advanced technology that lets light easily pass through the printed film that adheres to the wall-mounted mural panels, combining sustainable energy infrastructure with public art. The solar mural highlights the rich historical and cultural heritage of San Antonio’s West Side while teaching students the importance of using renewable energy. It also allows the school to take advantage of state and federal solar tax incentives.

The solar mural highlights the rich historical and cultural heritage of San Antonio’s West Side while teaching students the importance of using renewable energy. It also allows the school to take advantage of state and federal solar tax incentives.

Woodlawn Academy students highlighted the findings of a new Cultural Heritage pilot program during their school's Community Project Showcase last week.

Students at two other schools piloting the program — Briscoe Elementary School and Jefferson High School — also will present their work. Briscoe’s cultural heritage presentation will be held Thursday, Feb. 6 at 5 p.m.; and Jefferson’s project will be presented 9-11 a.m., 1-3 p.m., and 4:30-6:30 p.m. on Friday, March 20.

Read more: https://www.saisd.net/page/article/190

post_text:
Today, 6th-grade students from Harris Middle School held a memorial service in observance of the state's inaugural Holocaust Remembrance Week. The program featured poetry, music, and student exhibits.

In June 2019, Gov. Greg Abbott signed Senate Bill 1828 into law establishing Holocaust Remembrance Week throughout Texas public schools. Senator José Menéndez authored this bill and attended the event at Harris.

post_text: Quincy Stewart has been named the new head football coach at Sam Houston HS. For the past two years, he has served as the linebackers coach at Duncanville HS where the team advanced to the UIL Class 6A state championship game back-to-back seasons. The Tyler native began his coaching career in 2009 and has worked at five different Texas high schools. He played in the NFL for four different teams between 2001-2005 and won a 2005 Grey Cup with the Edmonton Eskimos in the Canadian Football League. He is married to Rhonda Thomas Stewart, a 1989 graduate of Sam Houston HS. Stewart inherits a Sam Houston Hurricanes team that has made the state playoffs 8 of the last 10 years.

He is married to Rhonda Thomas Stewart, a 1989 graduate of Sam Houston HS. Stewart inherits a Sam Houston Hurricanes team that has made the state playoffs 8 of the last 10 years.

post_text: Congratulations to the Burbank HS football coaching staff! The group has been selected to coach the “West Team” in the 2nd annual Showcase Athletics Texas All-Star High School Football Game Saturday, Jan. 11 at 3 p.m. at Southside Stadium. Approximately 88 high school football players from the state of Texas will participate in the game, including 3 athletes from SAISD. Juan Urbiola (wide receiver) and Toby Korrodi (quarterback), both of Burbank HS, and Adrian Cardenas (tight end) from Lanier HS will take part in the all-star game. The head coach for Burbank is Phil Barron. Barron and his assistants will coach against the Beaumont Kelly HS coaching staff, which will represent the “East Team.” Coach Barron and his Burbank Bulldogs raced to the state playoffs this past fall before bowing to Harlan HS in the bi-district title game.

The head coach for Burbank is Phil Barron. Barron and his assistants will coach against the Beaumont Kelly HS coaching staff, which will represent the “East Team.” Coach Barron and his Burbank Bulldogs raced to the state playoffs this past fall before bowing to Harlan HS in the bi-district title game.

post_text: A new student organization at Briscoe Elementary, SAISD - The Distinguished Gentlemen - was featured today on News 4 San Antonio! Watch the video clip here: https://news4sanantonio.com/sa-living/los-caballeros-distinguidos-the-distinguished-gentlemen
shared_text:
Anna Wendy Ulate
January 3 at 2:26 PM ·

🎩💜Couldn't be prouder of our gentlemen! They were perfect gentlemen this morning on the show! Thank you parents, teachers, friends, family, and community sponsors for your support in getting us here! Anyone that knows these gentlemen has had a hand in molding who they are: parents, siblings, cousins, neighbors, friends, teachers and staff, community figures and the list goes on. You all shaped them to be who they are now. They have always been gentlemen, they just needed to be given an opportunity to show the world! Los Caballeros Distinguidos is simply their bridge to greatness. 🎩💜
Here is the link for the actual story on CHannel 4!! https://news4sanantonio.com/sa-living/los-caballeros-distinguidos-the-distinguished-gentlemen

Visit Los Caballeros page for more info about our program!
https://www.facebook.com/distinguishedgentlemenbriscoe

SAISD is deeply saddened to learn of the death of our Detective Cliff Martinez early this morning, while working off-duty at an I-HOP. He was a highly-respected member of the SAISD Police Department, who worked for the department for 28 years. He will be greatly missed.

Our thoughts are with his family and friends during this difficult time.

post_text:
Bond Update - Fox Tech Campus: One feature that's become popular is the creation or addition of the learning staircase. The staircase, similar to the one built for the CAST Tech campus, is meant to transform into many different spaces for learning. Students can enjoy interactive lectures, watch presentations, gather in groups as a class, or participate in any number of other educational initiatives on the staircase.

The learning staircase at Fox Tech is located in the central mall area. Other notable highlights include the cafeteria relocation to the first floor to accommodate the three campuses that are now located on the Fox Tech campus (the Advanced Learning Academy's 4th-12th grades, and CAST Tech and Fox Tech high schools). The second phase of construction is underway with Bartlett Cocke construction. It began in May 2019.

shared_text:
CAST Tech
December 12, 2019 at 11:49 AM ·

4 CAST Tech NHS youth leaders went to the National LEAD Conference (on student leadership) held in Washington D.C. by National Association of Secondary School Principals (NASSP). Students received training on how to create a positive school culture and sustain student-led initiatives. This was also the first out of state travel for students at CAST Tech! It opens student group travel in future years!!

Andrea Torres, junior who went on the trip says “It was a lot of fun, we got to see places I’ve never been to. D.C. is interesting, after seeing everything that other schools have done, we get to bring those ideas to this school to use.”

APPLY TODAY!!!🙌👉 bit.ly/APPLYCAST
#CASTed by Jonathan

post_text: Congratulations to five SAISD student athletes who have been named to the San Antonio Sports All-Star Football Game. The District players are: Malachi Apreciado (athletic specialist) at Lanier HS; Diego Mauricio Cornejo (offensive tackle) and Jade Rios (tight end) at Brackenridge HS; Joe Klein (inside linebacker) at Burbank HS; and Ivan Reed (defensive end) at Sam Houston HS. The player’s coaches are Willie Hall (Brackenridge), Phil Barron (Burbank), Don Gatian (Lanier) and Louis James (Sam Houston). The all-star game will be played Saturday, Jan. 4, 2020 at 5 p.m. at the Alamodome. Tickets are now on sale and the game will be televised live by CW35.

post_text: SAISD Foundation representatives were in full force on “Giving Tuesday” as four teachers at Briscoe ES received surprise classroom visits and each were presented with $500 mini-grants. Winners included Sarah Christal (STAARy Nights project), Anna Ulate (Los Caballeros Distinguidos project), Ranaii Ortiz (Breakout EDU project) and Angela Williams (Flexible Seating project). Ms. Christal’s STAARy Nights project was featured at the presentation. Here, the classroom is transformed into a camp site setting, complete with tents, lanterns and a campfire. This environment allows students to become more aware with nature and stimulates learning. Today’s presentations launched a month-long campaign where a total of 200 mini-grants will be awarded at SAISD schools.

post_text:
Congratulations to Dr. Don Davis, a computer science teacher at CAST Tech High School. Dr. Davis was named the inaugural recipient of the Ron Moore Memorial Scholarship during the Alamo AFCEA Scholarship Luncheon this week. The scholarship award recognizes his outstanding contribution to education and the STEM career fields.

Dr. Don Davis has helped CAST Tech become named a Red Hat Academy, a designation typically held by community colleges and universities, which enables students to earn certifications that can lead to high-paying jobs in information technology after high school. Only 27 other U.S. schools have this designation — only two of which are based in Texas.

AFCEA, who presented the scholarship, is a professional association that enables military, government, industry and academia to align communications, information technology, intelligence and security strategy to meet the needs of those who serve.

post_text:
Bexar County and SAISD today announced a partnership on two developments for the Fox Tech campus area, which will benefit San Antonio residents as well as the District's students and staff. One initiative is creating a new iteration of the county's interactive digital libraries - called BiblioTech EDU - at the Fox Tech library, which will be open to SAISD students during the day and the public in the evenings.

The second project is constructing a parking garage across the street from Fox Tech, at the site of the future SAISD administration building, providing 600 spaces for employees during work hours and, at other times, for the public wishing to access San Pedro Creek Cultural Park and other downtown amenities.

The second project is constructing a parking garage across the street from Fox Tech, at the site of the future SAISD administration building, providing 600 spaces for employees during work hours and, at other times, for the public wishing to access San Pedro Creek Cultural Park and other downtown amenities.

post_text:
Today, M.L. King Academy students in Mrs. William’s 5th grade science class took a virtual field trip to the arctic tundra, the site of the annual Canadian polar bear migration. The students connected via video conference directly to the polar bear research team onsite in Churchill, Manitoba, Canada.

Their live question and answer session with representatives of Discovery Education and Polar Bears International was made possible by Trustee Alicia Perry, who won the package during a conference she attended on behalf of the District. As a result, students in her area received a VIP experience that allowed them to learn firsthand the answers to their questions on polar bears, the arctic ecosystem, sea ice habitat and climate change.

#CelebratewithDE
text:
Today, M.L. King Academy students in Mrs. William’s 5th grade science class took a virtual field trip to the arctic tundra, the site of the annual Canadian polar bear migration. The students connected via video conference directly to the polar bear research team onsite in Churchill, Manitoba, Canada.

Their live question and answer session with representatives of Discovery Education and Polar Bears International was made possible by Trustee Alicia Perry, who won the package during a conference she attended on behalf of the District. As a result, students in her area received a VIP experience that allowed them to learn firsthand the answers to their questions on polar bears, the arctic ecosystem, sea ice habitat and climate change.

#CelebratewithDE

post_text: Congratulations to the Brackenridge Eagles! Brack finished with a 7-3 record in the District 13-5A-1 football race and claimed the third place wildcard slot for the state playoffs. The Eagles will meet the Southwest Dragons, 5-5 overall, Friday at 7:30 pm at Dragon Stadium. Brack has qualified for the state playoffs 8 times in the last 10 years. The Eagles last playoff win came in 2012 when the team upset Alamo Heights 25-24 in a thriller. Willie Hall was hired as an assistant coach for Brack in 1983. He became the head coach in 1995. This is Hall’s 36th season with the team, The Eagles are loaded with talent. Jade Rios is a senior tight end who leads the team in receptions. Diego Mauricio Cornejo, 6-feet, 3-inches and 260 pounds, is a senior offensive tackle, who is the team’s anchor on the front line. Michael Puente is a senior defensive back, who is a crafty player that leads the City of San Antonio in interceptions with 7 for the season. The winner of the Brack and Southwest game will play the winner of the Corpus Christi Miller and Brownsville Pace game. Go Brack! Go SAISD!

post_text:
Five students won tablets yesterday and today as part of SAISD Child Nutrition Services' contests in celebration of National School Lunch Week. Pictured are the winners of the Elementary Coloring Contest, who drew their favorite cafeteria meal: Overall winner Ava from Hillcrest Elementary, and runners up Ramiro (drawing only), also from Hillcrest, and Ilyana from Baskin Elementary.

Middle and high school students’ names were entered in a drawing each time they ate a cafeteria meal. Winners (not pictured) were Jordan from Longfellow Middle School and Sharolet from Sam Houston High School.

Please help us in congratulating these students! We also thank all of our awesome students for participating.

post_text:
Sam Houston High School provided the color guard, ushers, and a company of cadets in formation for the annual Bexar County Buffalo Soldiers Veterans Day Commemorative Ceremony at the San Antonio National Cemetery today.

The historic Buffalo Soldiers became some of the most elite and decorated units in the U.S. Army. The soldiers were comprised of former slaves, freedmen and Black Civil War veterans.

post_text: Congratulations to a pair of student mariachis at Fox Tech and the Advance Learning Academy! Gabriela Villasana and Dayron Ibarra have qualified for the finals of the Mariachi Vargas Extravaganza National Vocal Competition on Dec. 7 at Lila Cockrell Theater. They will be competing against 42 other finalists. Gabriela and Dayron are the only two students from the city of San Antonio that will compete at the big event. Fox Tech mariachi instructors are David Zamarripa and Alicia Covarrubias.

post_text: Burbank and Lanier met in the annual Highway 90 Showdown in a wild back-and-forth football game at Alamo Stadium Saturday afternoon. The winner of the game would earn the final wildcard spot in the state playoffs for District 13-5A-1. Burbank came from behind in the final minutes of the game to escape past the Lanier Voks 28-27 in a nail-bitter in front of nearly 3,000 screaming fans. Burbank and Lanier finished with identical 4-4 records in the district race and the Bulldogs advance thanks to their head-to-head win over the Voks. Coach Phil Barron’s Bulldogs will make their first playoff appearance since 2017. Coach Don Gatian’s Voks played a hard fought game against the Bulldogs. Brackenridge, 6-2 in the district standings, is the other team from SAISD that will make the playoffs. We will report details on the playoff games next week. Go SAISD!

post_text: About 2,000 fans bundled up for the cold, rainy weather to watch the 53rd annual Tommy Bowl at Alamo Stadium last night. Jefferson outlasted Edison 20-7 in the district game finale for both teams. Running back Ryan Villareal raced for a spectacular pair of long touchdown runs – 52 yard TD and 41 yard TD - in the first quarter to pace the Mustangs. Mykal Hernandez added a touchdown for Jeff and Jon Alvarado scored the lone TD for Edison. Another large crowd is expected for Saturday’s huge game between Lanier and Burbank at Alamo Stadium. The game between the Voks and Bulldogs will have playoff implications and determine the fourth place wildcard spot. Kickoff is 2 pm. (Photo support Eddie Pena)

post_text: Congratulations to the Highlands HS volleyball team! The Lady Owls overwhelmed Medina Valley 3-0 (25-20, 25-21, 25-22) to win the Class 5A Bi-District Championship. Tonight, Highlands will meet Dripping Springs in the 2nd round of the state volleyball playoffs at Littleton Gym here in San Antonio at 7 pm. This is the second straight year that Coach Desiree Lara’s team has advanced to the 2nd round of the playoffs. Lara actually was a star player on the Highlands volleyball team when she was in high school in the early 2000s. The top playmakers for the Lady Owls are Brenda Davila, Chenise Cook, Briana Contreras and Jagger Torres. Let’s Go Owls! Go SAISD!

About 1,000 of SAISD's middle school and academy students are attending the San Antonio Hispanic Chamber of Commerce's CORE4 STEM event this week.

The event is a three-day immersion in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics to stimulate students’ interest in the sciences and lead them to discoveries about their own potential in these areas.

post_text:
More student success! Congratulations to the Jefferson Mustangs cross country teams. Competing at the District 27-5A championships, the Mustangs took home both the boys and girls team titles for the first time in over 25 years.

The Mustangs now head to Corpus Christi with a chance to make even more school history at regionals. The UIL Region IV Cross Country Championships began this morning. The girls will take the course at 11:50 a.m., while the boys will compete at 12:20 p.m.

post_text: Monarch Butterfly Migration: Lamar Elementary School released a Monarch Butterfly yesterday! The butterfly, a female, hatched yesterday morning between 8 a.m. and 9 a.m. See that little sticker on her wing?! Thanks to the National Wildlife Federation the school is able to record its Monarch in an international database to track her migration. If her tag is recovered in the overwintering sites in Mexico, students will know that their little classroom butterfly traveled over 800 miles! Wish her luck! Bon Voyage!
text: Monarch Butterfly Migration: Lamar Elementary School released a Monarch Butterfly yesterday! The butterfly, a female, hatched yesterday morning between 8 a.m. and 9 a.m. See that little sticker on her wing?! Thanks to the National Wildlife Federation the school is able to record its Monarch in an international database to track her migration. If her tag is recovered in the overwintering sites in Mexico, students will know that their little classroom butterfly traveled over 800 miles! Wish her luck! Bon Voyage!

text:
SAISD's Choice application period opens Nov. 5. Parent information sessions will be held for the District's educational models and program opportunities now through the end of January. Yesterday, parents learned about the Montessori educational model at Steele Montessori Academy - the first and only public Montessori school in the San Antonio area.

For more information about the application process, visit www.saisd.net/apply

post_text: The Burbank FFA Pumpkin Patch continues tonight from 4:45-7:45 p.m at the Burbank Farm. Parking is available at the SAISD Sports Complex and hayrides will transport families to the farm.

post_text: In an investiture ceremony yesterday, young women from SAISD high schools Districtwide joined Gamma Sigma Girls as part of Girl Scouts’ efforts to make membership more relevant to today’s generation of high school students. Middle school students also participated, joining Gamma Sigma Pearls.

post_text: Saturday was EPIC (Educators Providing Innovative Change)! SAISD held more than 80 professional development sessions including 7 Steps to a Language Rich Classroom, Digital Storytelling, Arts Integration, and Laughter Yoga as a Self-Care Tool.

post_text: Congratulations to the SAISD Marching Band programs! This weekend, 6 programs earned a 1st division and advanced to the Area Marching Contest. This is the first time in District history that this many programs have earned a 1st Division in one year.

post_text:
Last Friday, SAISD's Transportation Department rolled out its annual "Fall Festival Fun Bus" to 11 elementary schools to teach kids about the enjoyment of reading and school bus safety.

Did you know? This week is National School Bus Safety Week. Read more about SAISD's safety stats and what you can do to help: https://www.saisd.net/page/article/102

post_text: This morning, sixth graders from Lamar Elementary were treated to a presentation by Rodrigo Medellin, an ecologist known for his work in the field of bat conservation. The students have been studying migratory species that depend on San Antonio as a seasonal destination of refuge or an important pit stop on their journey. Medellin is in town for the Monarch Butterfly and Pollinator Festival this weekend, put on by Texas Butterfly Ranch.

It was a great evening! Burbank took home the trophy this year.

post_text: In a touching and meaningful event this morning, the District retired a United States flag at our N. Alamo building, a property that has been sold. The flag was placed there on Sept. 11, 2001 by then-director of the Facilities Services Department Lanny Worel, and the flag has meant a lot to the people who have occupied the building all these years. Today's ceremony was conducted by the color guard of the SAISD Police Department. The flag will be returned to Mr. Worel.

Today's ceremony was conducted by the color guard of the SAISD Police Department. The flag will be returned to Mr. Worel.

post_text: This morning at Barkley-Ruiz Elementary School, students, staff and District administration gathered to celebrate the groundbreaking of a new high-speed fiber network, which will use nearly 80 miles of fiber to connect every single SAISD campus and office facility. Read more about what this lightning-fast network means for students: https://www.saisd.net/page/article/96

post_text:
Last night, four SAISD alumni were honored for being an inspiration to others during SAISD Foundation's Inspire Awards ceremony.

Congratulations to:
- Diego Bernal (Jefferson HS/Class of 1995), state representative for the Texas House of Representatives
- Yvonne “Bonnie” Garcia (Burbank HS/Class of 1975), the founder and CEO for MarketVision, a leading multicultural marketing agency in the United States
- Paula Gold-Williams (Sam Houston HS/Class of 1980), the president and CEO of CPS Energy in San Antonio
- Cosmo F. Guido (Jefferson HS/Class of 1940), chairman emeritus for Guido Construction, an iconic family business and full-service general contractor that has served San Antonio and the state of Texas since 1927

Read the full story here: https://www.saisd.net/page/com-Insider-2019-10-03-InspireAwards

post_text: Recently, a corner of the Tafolla Middle School cafeteria looked more like a Food Network test kitchen than a typical school eating facility. Decked out in his black chef’s coat, Chef Jimmy Villarreal, SAISD culinary specialist, held a cooking demonstration to introduce students to one of SAISD’s newest menu additions, lo mein salad. Students sampled the dish before going through the lunch line to sample two more recent menu additions, an Asian broccoli salad and sweet and sour chicken with a scratch sauce. Read the full story: https://www.saisd.net/page/article/62

post_text: Last week, Graebner Elementary School hosted its first "Fathers In Action" event. About 100 dads, grandpas and other relatives joined in a meeting to discuss ways to improve the participation, involvement and school support of students' male role models. The meeting will become an annual tradition.

post_text: The Alamo Colleges District announced the first phase of its AlamoPROMISE initiative for 25 high schools across the San Antonio area, with nine of those schools in SAISD, at Jefferson High School today. #AlamoPROMISE #EliminatingBarriers
